verses.verse: Jacob <S%H3290><s%> lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and looked, <S%H7200><s%> and, <S%H6215><s%> behold, Esau was coming, <S%H935><s%> and with him four <S%H702><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> men. <S%H376><s%> He divided <S%H2673><s%> the children <S%H3206><s%> between Leah, <S%H3812><s%> Rachel, <S%H7354><s%> and the two <S%H8147><s%> handmaids. <S%H8198><s%>

He put <S%H7760><s%> the handmaids <S%H8198><s%> and their children <S%H3206><s%> in front, <S%H7223><s%> Leah <S%H3812><s%> and her children <S%H3206><s%> after, <S%H314><s%> and Rachel <S%H7354><s%> and Joseph <S%H3130><s%> at the rear. <S%H314><s%>

He himself passed over <S%H5674><s%> in front of them, <S%H6440><s%> and bowed himself <S%H7812><s%> to the ground <S%H776><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> times, <S%H6471><s%> until he came near <S%H5066><s%> to his brother. <S%H251><s%>
Esau <S%H6215><s%> ran <S%H7323><s%> to meet him, <S%H7125><s%> embraced <S%H2263><s%> him, <S%H5307><s%> fell on his neck, <S%H6677><s%> kissed him, <S%H5401><s%> and they wept. <S%H1058><s%>

He lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> the women <S%H802><s%> and the children; <S%H3206><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Who are these <S%H428><s%> with you? <S%H559><s%>" He said, "The children <S%H3206><s%> whom God <S%H430><s%> has graciously given <S%H2603><s%> your servant. <S%H5650><s%>"
Then the handmaids <S%H8198><s%> came near <S%H5066><s%> with their children, <S%H3206><s%> and they bowed themselves. <S%H7812><s%>

Leah <S%H3812><s%> also and her children <S%H3206><s%> came near, <S%H5066><s%> and bowed themselves. <S%H7812><s%> After <S%H310><s%> them, <S%H3130><s%> Joseph came <S%H5066><s%> near <S%H5066><s%> with Rachel, <S%H7354><s%> and they bowed themselves. <S%H7812><s%>

Esau said, <S%H559><s%> "What do you mean by all this company <S%H4264><s%> which I met? <S%H6298><s%>" Jacob said, <S%H559><s%> "To find <S%H4672><s%> favor <S%H2580><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of my lord. <S%H113><s%>"
Esau <S%H6215><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "I have <S%H3426><s%> enough, <S%H7227><s%> my brother; <S%H251><s%> let that which you have be yours."

Jacob <S%H3290><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Please, <S%H4672><s%> no, if I have now found favor <S%H2580><s%> in your sight, <S%H5869><s%> then receive <S%H3947><s%> my present <S%H4503><s%> at my hand, <S%H3027><s%> because I have seen <S%H7200><s%> your face, <S%H6440><s%> as one sees <S%H7200><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of God, <S%H430><s%> and you were pleased with me. <S%H7521><s%>

Please take <S%H3947><s%> the gift <S%H1293><s%> that I brought <S%H935><s%> to you, <S%H430><s%> because God has dealt graciously with me, <S%H2603><s%> and because <S%H3605><s%> I have <S%H3426><s%> enough. <S%H3605><s%>" He urged <S%H6484><s%> him, <S%H3947><s%> and he took it.
Esau said, <S%H559><s%> "Let us take our journey, <S%H5265><s%> and let us go, <S%H3212><s%> and I will go before you. <S%H3212><s%>"

Jacob said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H113><s%> "My lord knows <S%H3045><s%> that the children <S%H3206><s%> are tender, <S%H7390><s%> and that the flocks <S%H6629><s%> and herds <S%H1241><s%> with me have their young, <S%H5763><s%> and if they overdrive <S%H1849><s%> them one <S%H259><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> all the flocks <S%H6629><s%> will die. <S%H4191><s%>

Please let my lord <S%H113><s%> pass over <S%H5674><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> his servant, <S%H5650><s%> and I will lead on <S%H5095><s%> gently, <S%H328><s%> according to <S%H7272><s%> the pace of the livestock <S%H4399><s%> that are before me <S%H6440><s%> and according to the pace <S%H7272><s%> of the children, <S%H3206><s%> until I come <S%H935><s%> to my lord <S%H113><s%> to Seir. <S%H8165><s%>"

Esau <S%H6215><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Let me now leave <S%H3322><s%> with you some of the folk <S%H5971><s%> who are with me. <S%H559><s%>" He said, "Why? <S%H4100><s%> Let me find <S%H4672><s%> favor <S%H2580><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of my lord. <S%H113><s%>"
So Esau <S%H6215><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> that day <S%H3117><s%> on his way <S%H1870><s%> to Seir. <S%H8165><s%>

Jacob <S%H3290><s%> traveled <S%H5265><s%> to Succoth, <S%H5523><s%> built <S%H1129><s%> himself a house, <S%H1004><s%> and made <S%H6213><s%> shelters <S%H5521><s%> for his livestock. <S%H4735><s%> Therefore the name <S%H8034><s%> of the place <S%H4725><s%> is called <S%H7121><s%> Succoth. <S%H5523><s%>

Jacob <S%H3290><s%> came <S%H935><s%> in peace <S%H8004><s%> to the city <S%H5892><s%> of Shechem, <S%H7927><s%> which is in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan, <S%H3667><s%> when he came <S%H935><s%> from Paddan <S%H6307><s%> Aram; <S%H2583><s%> and encamped before <S%H6440><s%> the city. <S%H5892><s%>

He bought <S%H7069><s%> the parcel <S%H2513><s%> of ground <S%H7704><s%> where he had spread <S%H5186><s%> his tent, <S%H168><s%> at the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Hamor, <S%H2544><s%> Shechem <S%H7927><s%>'s father, <S%H1><s%> for one hundred <S%H3967><s%> pieces of money. <S%H7192><s%>
He erected <S%H5324><s%> an altar <S%H4196><s%> there, <S%H7121><s%> and called it El Elohe Israel. <S%H415><s%>
